unnormalised: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) announced an increase in bus fares by 15% effective 01/07/2024. The hike is attributed to rising fuel costs and maintenance expenses. Routes like Mumbai to Pune, a distance of approx. 150 km, will see a fare increase of approximately Rs. 75 per passenger.
normalised: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (M-S-R-T-C) announced an increase in bus fares by fifteen percent effective first july two thousand and twenty four. The hike is attributed to rising fuel costs and maintenance expenses. Routes like Mumbai to Pune, a distance of approximately one hundred and fifty kilometer, will see a fare increase of approximately rupee seventy five per passenger.

unnormalised: Private taxi and auto-rickshaw unions in Delhi-NCR are also considering fare revisions. The Delhi Autorickshaw Sangh has proposed a minimum fare of Rs. 30 for the first 1.5 km, citing CNG price hikes. This could affect daily commuters relying on these modes of transport for short distances within the city and nearby areas like Gurgaon and Noida. Ola and Uber have not yet released any statements regarding price revisions.
normalised: Private taxi and auto-rickshaw unions in Delhi-N-C-R are also considering fare revisions. The Delhi Autorickshaw Sangh has proposed a minimum fare of rupee thirty for the first one point five kilometer, citing C-N-G price hikes. This could affect daily commuters relying on these modes of transport for short distances within the city and nearby areas like Gurgaon and Noida. Ola and Uber have not yet released any statements regarding price revisions.

unnormalised: Concerns are being raised about the affordability of local transport for low-income individuals. Commuters are urging the government to explore alternative solutions to mitigate the impact of fare increases, such as subsidies or tax reductions on fuel. The next review of transport fares is scheduled for Q4 2024.
